executiveSummary: Jeff Cranny pitched LockStraps to the Sharks, seeking $200,000 for 20% equity. He demonstrated the strength of his straps compared to traditional cable locks but struggled to provide clear sales data and financial history, particularly after a failed Home Depot order. The Sharks were concerned about his lack of active involvement in the business and unclear path forward, ultimately leading to no investment offers.
keyDecisions: No major decisions recorded; all Sharks declined to invest.

actionItems.task: Clarify and provide detailed sales data and financial history, including units sold and royalties received
Develop a clear operational plan showing active involvement in product quality and distribution
Assess market competition and pricing strategy to improve product viability

nextSteps: Jeff will continue managing LockStraps independently, focusing on regaining control over product manufacturing and sales while considering adjustments to improve market success.
